[More PHP]Making a auto generated Webpage?

General Programming
sk8rdude461 August 4, 2016, 1:18am #1

I really need someone I could just go to for php help, instead of spamming topics in here lol <3 the web dev section.
So here’s the basics. My site has a Nav bar on the left side, Logo on top, and the mid/right is taken up with news feed (about 4 posts are shown at a time). Each post has a “read more” option to go further in depth on what the update is (Obvious RSPS is obvious). What I want to do, is make it so I don’t need to jump in there, and edit the page for each update, and make new ones for the old updates, etc. So what I was thinking is I could create a login page, where there is only 1 user (i.e me) that has an account, and that would re-direct you to a form where you put in the Announcement name (i.e Server Maintenance for X hours), the date of the update (no explanation needed), the short description, and the extended description. The short description would be put on the main page (home page), and the extended description would be on the auto-generated news update article.

Anyone know how to go about doing this? Please and thankies.

Ruby_Forums_Coder August 4, 2016, 1:18am #2

Why not just link it to the forums instead of making a whole archive just for news and announcements?

sk8rdude461 August 4, 2016, 1:18am #3
Ruby:

Why not just link it to the forums instead of making a whole archive just for news and announcements?

Because I don’t know how to do that either.
I know how to link it like for the read more section. But that’s not the key of doing this.
Fast edit: I’m going to have to experiment with this a bit. If I knew how to make php delete something, or at least hide it, I’m sure I could accomplish something simplistic, but I don’t

Vain1 August 4, 2016, 1:18am #4

Make a template.

<?php
 include_once('header.tpl.php'); //header
  //mysql crap
 include_once('footer.tpl.php'); //footer
?>

Query all the ‘news’ into a database, display them all on the homepage. When you click to edit, only load the single news item into the template.

Sorry for the piss-poor explanation.

That’s why he stated to look into the code. Looking at a basic news script that someone made will help you get a better understanding of what certain things do (especially if the source has comments).

Note that I said basic. Looking at a well developed system that has numerous contributors and is based on OOP or MVC will not really help a new person learn much.
